definition: A term commonly employed to describe the course, progression, or development of something over time. It is frequently used to refer to the trajectory or path that events, processes, or actions follow.

examples.german: Der Verlauf der Krankheit war schwer vorherzusagen.
examples.english: The course of the disease was difficult to predict.

examples.german: Der Verlauf des Flusses ist sehr malerisch.
examples.english: The course of the river is very picturesque.

examples.german: Der Verlauf der Verhandlungen war langwierig.
examples.english: The progress of the negotiations was protracted.

examples.german: Der Verlauf der Straße führt direkt zum Bahnhof.
examples.english: The route of the road leads directly to the train station.

examples.german: Der Verlauf des Vortrags war gut strukturiert.
examples.english: The structure of the presentation was well organized.
